intro: Sorengia longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved sorrel, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and alternate, lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Sorengia longifolia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the sorrel family, with a preference for temperate climates.
